findings.title: Malformed data could cause the transaction parser to loop infinitely
findings.description: The internal `parser_runtimeargs_getData` function could loop infinitely if provided with malformed data due to a mismatch between the `uint8_t` loop index variable and the `uint32_t` loop bound variable.

findings.title: Use of uninitialized memory when ZEMU_LOGGING is defined
findings.description: In a build where the `ZEMU_LOGGING` macro is defined, the `addr_getItem` function calls the `zemu_log_stack` function with uninitialized memory, invoking undefined behavior.

findings.title: Limited effectiveness of the transaction parser fuzz target
findings.description: The following issues limit the effectiveness of the existing fuzz target for the transaction parser: duplicated scripts and missing comma in run-fuzzers.py script.

findings.title: Bug in divBigNumbersWithPrecision function
findings.description: The `divBigNumbersWithPrecision` function contains a typo in an `if` statement that checks whether the `convertedDenominator` is greater than or equal to itself, always returning `true`, and causing the `else` block to never be evaluated.

findings.title: Implementing these recommendations into a seed corpus prior to fuzzing
findings.description: The effectiveness of the existing fuzzing infrastructure can be improved by creating a seed corpus of well-formed transaction inputs for the transaction parser fuzz target and implementing other short-term and long-term recommendations.

findings.title: Typo in divBigNumbersWithPrecision Function
findings.description: The `divBigNumbersWithPrecision` function contains a typo in an `if` statement, causing the `else` block to never be evaluated.
